name: Ant Design
description: A design system with values of Nature and Determinacy for better user experience of enterprise applications.

concepts.name: primary
concepts.description: Styled with the primary theme color.

concepts.name: default
concepts.description: No special formatting, also eluded to as a secondary button.

concepts.name: dashed
concepts.description: Has a dashed outline.

concepts.name: danger
concepts.description: Is red colored.

concepts.name: link
concepts.description: Formatted like an anchor tag with button padding.

concepts.name: icon
concepts.description: Button components can contain an Icon

concepts.name: small
concepts.description: Ant Design supports a default button size as well as a large and small size.

concepts.name: large
concepts.description: Ant Design supports a default button size as well as a large and small size.

concepts.name: circle
concepts.description: Can be set to circle, round or omitted.

concepts.name: round
concepts.description: Can be set to circle, round or omitted.

concepts.name: loading
concepts.description: Set the loading status of button.

concepts.name: ghost
concepts.description: Make background transparent and invert text and border colors. It is common used in colored background.

concepts.name: block
concepts.description: block property will make the button fit to its parent width.

components.name: Breadcrumb
components.definition: A breadcrumb displays the current location within a hierarchy. It allows going back to states higher up in the hierarchy.

concepts.name: basic
concepts.description: Basic Breadcrumb

concepts.name: icon
concepts.description: Breadcrumb with icon

concepts.name: divider
concepts.description: Breadcrumb with custom divider

concepts.name: dropdown
concepts.description: Breadcrumb with dropdown

components.name: Dropdown
components.definition: A dropdown list. When To Use: If there are too many operations to display, you can wrap them in a Dropdown. By clicking/hovering on the trigger, a dropdown menu should appear, which allows you to choose one option and execute relevant actions.

concepts.name: disabled
concepts.description: whether the dropdown menu is disabled

concepts.name: getPopupContainer
concepts.description: to set the container of the dropdown menu. The default is to create a div element in body, you can reset it to the scrolling area and make a relative reposition. example	Function(triggerNode)	() => document.body

concepts.name: overlay
concepts.description: the dropdown menu

concepts.name: overlayClassName
concepts.description: Class name of the dropdown root element

concepts.name: overlayStyle
concepts.description: Style of the dropdown root element

concepts.name: placement
concepts.description: placement of pop menu: bottomLeft bottomCenter bottomRight topLeft topCenter topRight	String	bottomLeft

concepts.name: trigger
concepts.description: the trigger mode which executes the drop-down action, hover doesn't work on mobile device Array<click|hover|contextMenu>

concepts.name: visible
concepts.description: whether the dropdown menu is visible

concepts.name: onVisibleChange
concepts.description: a callback function takes an argumen't: visible, is executed when the visible state is changed

concepts.name: disabled
concepts.description: whether the dropdown menu is disabled

concepts.name: icon
concepts.description: icon of right

concepts.name: overlay
concepts.description: the dropdown menu

concepts.name: placement
concepts.description: placement of pop menu: bottomLeft bottomCenter bottomRight topLeft topCenter topRight	String	bottomLeft

concepts.name: size
concepts.description: size of the button, the same as Button

concepts.name: trigger
concepts.description: the trigger mode which executes the drop-down action, hover doesn't work on mobile device Array<click|hover|contextMenu>

concepts.name: type
concepts.description: type of the button, the same as Button

concepts.name: visible
concepts.description: whether the dropdown menu is visible

concepts.name: onClick
concepts.description: a callback function, the same as Button, which will be executed when you click the button on the left

concepts.name: onVisibleChange
concepts.description: a callback function takes an argumen't: visible, is executed when the visible state is changed

components.name: Dropdown.Popup
components.definition: A dropdown list. When To Use: If there are too many operations to display, you can wrap them in a Dropdown. By clicking/hovering on the trigger, a dropdown menu should appear, which allows you to choose one option and execute relevant actions.

concepts.name: dropdown
concepts.description: A dropdown list

concepts.name: basic
concepts.description: Basic checkbox

concepts.name: autoFocus
concepts.description: get focus when component mounted

concepts.name: checked
concepts.description: Specifies whether the checkbox is selected.

concepts.name: disabled
concepts.description: Disable checkbox

concepts.name: indeterminate
concepts.description: indeterminate checked state of checkbox

concepts.name: disabled
concepts.description: Disable all checkboxes

concepts.name: name
concepts.description: The name property of all input[type="checkbox"] children

concepts.name: options
concepts.description: Specifies options

concepts.name: value
concepts.description: Used for setting the currently selected value.

concepts.name: cascader
concepts.description: Display a notification message globally.

concepts.name: range presets
concepts.description: Datepicker can have presets for range selection

concepts.name: footer
concepts.description: Datepicker can have custom footer

concepts.name: size
concepts.description: Datepicker can have different sizes

concepts.name: custom cells
concepts.description: Datepicker can have custom cells rendering

concepts.name: basic
concepts.description: The simplest use, unchecked.

concepts.name: disabled
concepts.description: Disabled for interaction.

concepts.name: checked
concepts.description: Selected option.

concepts.name: default
concepts.description: Displayed as a button.

concepts.name: button
concepts.description: Displayed as a button.

concepts.name: solid-button
concepts.description: Different appearences for buttons.

concepts.name: big
concepts.description: Sizing that seems to just apply to buttons.

concepts.name: medium
concepts.description: Sizing that seems to just apply to buttons.

concepts.name: small
concepts.description: Sizing that seems to just apply to buttons.

concepts.name: inline
concepts.description: Horizontally laid-out.

concepts.name: stacked
concepts.description: Vertically laid-out.

components.name: Switch
components.definition: Switching Selector. When To Use: If you need to represent the switching between two states or on-off state. The difference between Switch and Checkbox is that Switch will trigger a state change directly when you toggle it, while Checkbox is generally used for state marking, which should work in conjunction with submit operation.

concepts.name: basic
concepts.description: basic switch

concepts.name: autoFocus
concepts.description: get focus when component mounted

concepts.name: checked
concepts.description: determine whether the Switch is checked

concepts.name: checkedChildren
concepts.description: content to be shown when the state is checked

concepts.name: disabled
concepts.description: Disable switch

concepts.name: loading
concepts.description: loading state of switch

concepts.name: default
concepts.description: the size of the Switch: default

concepts.name: small
concepts.description: the size of the Switch, options: default small	string

concepts.name: unCheckedChildren
concepts.description: content to be shown when the state is unchecked

components.name: Slider
components.definition: Select component to select value from options. When To Use: A dropdown menu for displaying choices - an elegant alternative to the native <select> element. Utilizing Radio is recommended when there are fewer total options (less than 5).

components.name: Select
components.definition: Select component to select value from options. When To Use: A dropdown menu for displaying choices - an elegant alternative to the native <select> element. Utilizing Radio is recommended when there are fewer total options (less than 5).

concepts.name: allowClear
concepts.description: Show clear button.

concepts.name: open
concepts.description: Controlled open state of dropdown

concepts.name: defaultOpen
concepts.description: Initial open state of dropdown

concepts.name: value
concepts.description: Current selected option.

concepts.name: defaultValue
concepts.description: Initial selected option.

concepts.name: placeholder
concepts.description: Placeholder of select

concepts.name: autoFocus
concepts.description: Get focus by default

concepts.name: onChange
concepts.description: Called when select an option or input value change, or value of input is changed in combobox mode

concepts.name: onSelect
concepts.description: Called when a option is selected, the params are option's value (or key) and option instance.

concepts.name: onDeselect
concepts.description: Called when a option is deselected, param is the selected option's value. Only called for multiple or tags, effective in multiple or tags mode only.

concepts.name: onSearch
concepts.description: Callback function that is fired when input changed.

concepts.name: onFocus
concepts.description: Called when focus

concepts.name: onBlur
concepts.description: Called when focus

concepts.name: onInputKeyDown
concepts.description: Called when key pressed

concepts.name: onMouseEnter
concepts.description: Called when mouse enter

concepts.name: onMouseLeave
concepts.description: Called when mouse leave

concepts.name: onPopupScroll
concepts.description: Called when dropdown scrolls

concepts.name: dropdownMatchSelectWidth
concepts.description: Whether dropdown's width is same with select.

components.name: Select
components.definition: Select component to select value from options. When To Use: A dropdown menu for displaying choices - an elegant alternative to the native <select> element. Utilizing Radio is recommended when there are fewer total options (less than 5).

concepts.name: allowClear
concepts.description: Show clear button.

concepts.name: treeselect
concepts.description: Similar to Select, but the values are provided in a tree like structure

components.name: Avatar
components.definition: Avatars can be used to represent people or objects. It supports images, Icons, or letters.

concepts.name: image
concepts.description: The avatar can be an image.

concepts.name: letter
concepts.description: The Avatar can display a name or initials.

concepts.name: icon
concepts.description: The avatar can display an icon.

concepts.name: square
concepts.description: The shape of avatar can be square.

concepts.name: badge
concepts.description: With Badge. Usually used for reminders and notifications.

concepts.name: color
concepts.description: Avatar can have custom colors and background colors

components.name: Badge
components.definition: Small numerical value or status descriptor for UI elements.

concepts.name: basic
concepts.description: Simplest Usage. Badge will be hidden when count is 0, but we can use showZero to show it.

concepts.name: count
concepts.description: ${overflowCount}+ is displayed when count is larger than overflowCount. The default value of overflowCount is 99

concepts.name: dynamic
concepts.description: The count will be animated as it changes.

concepts.name: ribbon
concepts.description: Use ribbon badge

concepts.name: sizes
concepts.description: Set size of numeral Badge.

concepts.name: afterChange
concepts.description: Callback function called after the current index changes

concepts.name: autoplay
concepts.description: Whether to scroll automatically

concepts.name: beforeChange
concepts.description: Callback function called before the current index changes

concepts.name: dotPosition
concepts.description: The position of the dots, which can be one of top bottom left right

concepts.name: dots
concepts.description: Whether to show the dots at the bottom of the gallery

concepts.name: easing
concepts.description: Transition interpolation function name

concepts.name: effect
concepts.description: Transition effect

concepts.name: borderless
concepts.description: A borderless card on a gray background

concepts.name: grid
concepts.description: A card's content can be organized in a grid

concepts.name: title
concepts.description: A card can have a title at the top

concepts.name: hoverable
concepts.description: A card can be applied a style on hover

concepts.name: loading
concepts.description: A loading card shows a loading indicator while the contents of the card are being fetched

concepts.name: meta
concepts.description: Card.Meta can be used to support more flexible content

concepts.name: inner
concepts.description: An inner card can be placed inside the ordinary card to display the information of the multilevel structure

concepts.name: tabs
concepts.description: A card can host more content within tabs

concepts.name: default
concepts.description: Ant Design supports two card sizes: default and small

concepts.name: small
concepts.description: Ant Design supports two card sizes: default and small

concepts.name: extra
concepts.description: A card can render extra content in the top-right corner

components.name: Modal
components.definition: A new floating layer over the current page to get user feedback or display information.

concepts.name: modal
concepts.description: A new floating layer over the current page to get user feedback or display information.

components.name: Popover
components.definition: A simple popup menu to provide extra information or operations.

concepts.name: popover
concepts.description: A simple popup menu to provide extra information or operations.

concepts.name: placement
concepts.description: There are 12 placement options available.

concepts.name: arrowPointAtCenter
concepts.description: By specifying arrowPointAtCenter prop, the arrow will point to the center of the target element.

concepts.name: color
concepts.description: We preset a series of colorful Tooltip styles for use in different situations.

concepts.name: closable
concepts.description: The Tag can be closable.

concepts.name: icon
concepts.description: Tag components can contain an Icon.

concepts.name: color
concepts.description: Tag can have custom background color

concepts.name: checkable
concepts.description: Tag can have checked state.

concepts.name: borderless
concepts.description: Tag can be borderless

concepts.name: message
concepts.description: Display global messages as feedback in response to user operations

concepts.name: notification
concepts.description: Display a notification message globally.

components.name: Popconfirm
components.definition: A simple and compact confirmation dialog of an action.

concepts.name: popconfirm
concepts.description: A simple and compact confirmation dialog of an action.

concepts.name: default
concepts.description: Basic usage (preview)
